name: Adjacency Laplacian
intent: Encode how semantic influence diffuses across adjacency networks and define the core operator for adjacency waves.
algebraic\_properties: Δ is defined by Δ r(i) \= d(i) r(i) \- Σ\_j A(i,j) r(j), where A is a weighted adjacency matrix.
Δ is positive semi-definite for symmetric A with non-negative weights.
Eigenpairs (λ\_k, u\_k) of Δ define semantic modes and resonances on the adjacency network.
constraints: The adjacency graph (V, A) must be at least locally finite to ensure Δ is well-defined.
Δ may be extended to continuous or higher-structure settings (manifolds, sheaves, etc.) as needed.
